channel.title: Swift on Server
channel.description: Articles about server-side Swift development. Created by Joannis Orlandos and Tibor BÃ¶decs.

item.title: WebSocket tutorial using Swift and Hummingbird
item.description: In this article, you will learn about WebSockets and how to use them with the Hummingbird framework in a straightforward, easy-to-follow manner.

item.title: Introduction to Swift Service Lifecycle
item.description: This article offers practical examples to introduce the Swift Service Lifecycle library.

item.title: Templating with Swift-Mustache
item.description: Learn how to template emails and web pages with Swift-Mustache.

item.title: Useful scripts for server-side Swift libraries
item.description: Learn about shell scripts to enforce coding standards and conduct checks for backend Swift projects.

item.title: AsyncHTTPClient by example
item.description: This article offers practical examples to introduce the Swift AsyncHTTPClient library.

item.title: Structured Concurrency and Shared State in Swift
item.description: Learn how actors and sendable prevent race conditions in your concurrent code.

item.title: Getting Started with Structured Concurrency in Swift
item.description: Learn how to apply structured concurrency in your applications, using task groups and other structured concepts.

item.title: Using environment variables in Swift
item.description: Explore the importance of environment variables in Swift and how to use them.

item.title: Using OpenAPI Generator with Hummingbird
item.description: Learn how to use OpenAPI Generator to create Swift APIs with Hummingbird.

item.title: What's new in Hummingbird 2?
item.description: Discover Hummingbird 2: a Swift-based HTTP server framework, with modern concurrency and customizable request contexts.

item.title: Building an HTTP client using SwiftNIO
item.description: Learn how to build a simple HTTP client using SwiftNIO and structured concurrency.

item.title: Logging for server-side Swift apps
item.description: Discover how to integrate the Logging library into an application, use various log levels, and tailor the unified logging API for backend projects.

item.title: Using SwiftNIO - Channels
item.description: Create a TCP server using SwiftNIO and structured concurrency

item.title: Using SwiftNIO - Fundamentals
item.description: Learn the fundamental concepts of SwiftNIO, such as EventLoops and nonblocking I/O

item.title: Developing with Swift in Visual Studio Code
item.description: Learn how to set up your Visual Studio Code for Swift development using Docker, Dev Containers and the Swift for VS Code extension.
